quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Oscar Wilde and Oscar Wildes
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, john, nobleman. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: John Farson was the gunslinger who brought down the Affiliation in The Dark Tower series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This Oscar Wilde tragedy, originally written in French in 1891, was banned in England until 1931.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salome

questions.question: What drama film, starring Scarlett Johansson as Meg Windermere, is based on Oscar Wildes play Lady Windermeres Fan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Good Woman

questions.question: Which characters created by Oscar Wilde are not correctly paired with the literary work?

options.text: The Picture of Dorian Gray - Basil Hallward, Sybil Vane
Lady Windermeres Fan - Mrs Erlynne, Lord Darlington
The Importance of Being Earnest - Gwendolen Fairfax, Algernon (Algy) Moncrieff

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salome - Simone Grosso, Beatrice

questions.question: What was the name of the book that contained the short story The Little Sisters of Eluria, a prequel to The Gunslinger?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Everything’s Eventual

questions.question: The death penalty is the main theme of this poem by Oscar Wilde which contains the following often quoted lines:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ballad of Reading Gaol

questions.question: Oscar Wilde is associated with this art movement that began in the late Victorian period and is considered to have ended with Oscar Wildes trial in in 1895.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aestheticism

questions.question: Name the witty nobleman who conveys to Dorian Gray his view of indulgent hedonism in one of Oscar Wildes most famous works?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Wotton

questions.question: Oscar Wilde was imprisoned for two years after being convicted of this crime.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: gross indecency

questions.question: Complete the following statement made by one of Oscar Wildes characters: Nothing makes one so vain as being told one is ..............
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a sinner

questions.question: In the book The Dark Tower, Susannah becomes physically separated from Mia and gives birth to Mordred, while Mia is killed by a group of vampires.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This literary work, whose preface ends with the sentence, All art is quite useless, is Oscar Wildes only published novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Picture of Dorian Gray

questions.question: In Stephen Kings novel The Dark Tower, Mordred has the ability to transform himself into what type of creature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spider

questions.question: While in prison Oscar Wilde wrote De Profundis, an extended letter in which he expressed his bitter criticism towards this English author, better known as Wildes intimate friend.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord Alfred Douglas

questions.question: The novel The Dark Tower begins where Song of Susannah left off.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Character and Dark Tower
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, villains, ambition. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On their travels in the book The Dark Tower, the ka-tet come to a place called ODDS LANE (the S had been added by hand). The only person who lived here was an old guy who called himself Joe Collins, but what was his real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dandelo

questions.question: This complex Shakespearean character, who is a villain at one point and a victim at another, demanded a pound of flesh and rendered no mercy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shylock

questions.question: Name the Scottish King whom Macbeth murdered, led by his thirst for power and desire to obtain the throne.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Duncan

questions.question: What Shakespearean character usurped the throne by murdering his brother and then married the late kings widow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Claudius

questions.question: Driven by jealousy, anguish and ambition, this character from a history play by Shakespeare uttered the words, I am determined to prove a villain / and hate the idle pleasures of these days.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard III

questions.question: This character, often regarded as one of Shakespeares most malevolent villains, is an expert manipulator, who states, I am not what I am.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iago

questions.question: Once reunited in the book The Dark Tower, the ka-tet travel to a town called Fedic to stop the activity of a group of individuals who use their psychic powers to break apart the beams that hold the Dark Tower and Mid-World together. What is the name given to this group of psychics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breakers

questions.question: This character, who commits a number of villainous acts throughout the course of the play King Lear, is the illegitimate son of the Earl of Gloucester.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edmund

questions.question: In The Dark Tower, Stephen King urges the reader to stop reading at a certain point in the book and not go any further.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which member of the ka-tet is mortally wounded in The Dark Tower in the battle to free the psychics of Fedic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie

questions.question: In the novel The Dark Tower, in Joe Collins basement the ka-tet discover a young man named Patrick Danville imprisoned in a cage. What particular skill does Patrick have?

options.text: He is blind and cannot be influenced by the all-seeing eye of The Crimson King.
He can travel between worlds simply by thinking about them.
He can block the destructive thoughts of the psychics who are destroying the Beams.
He is a gifted artist whose drawings become reality.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is a gifted artist whose drawings become reality.

questions.question: Name King Lears brutal son-in-law who gouged out Gloucesters eyes in Shakespeares tragedy King Lear.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duke of Cornwall

questions.question: What character from the play Julius Caesar incites the conspiracy against Caesar and plays a leading role in his assassination?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cassius

questions.question: In the final novel of The Dark Tower series, Jake, Roland and Oy travel to Maine in 1999 to do what important task?

options.text: Deliver a rose to Jakes dying mother
Close a tear between the worlds that was causing strange creatures to enter 1999
Save the life of Stephen King

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Save the life of Stephen King

questions.question: When close to his goal, The Dark Tower, Roland is attacked by Mordred. Who saves Rolands life, but dies in the process?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oy

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Ark Angel and Alex Rider
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, john, ark. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: During the Peace of Amiens,” fictional adventure series character Hornblower is beached and penniless. How does Hornblower make ends meet during this period?

options.text: Working as a fishing boat captain

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Playing whist

questions.question: One aspect of the physical constitution of fictional officer Hornblowers isolates him from a simple human pleasure. What is it?

options.text: Hornblower has no sense of smell or taste resulting in joyless eating.
Poor eyesight and color blindness result in his inability to comprehend beauty and art.
Dyslexia, or a dyslexia-like condition, prevents Hornblower from being able to read and write.
Tone deafness prevents Hornblower from enjoying or even comprehending music.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tone deafness prevents Hornblower from enjoying or even comprehending music.

questions.question: What was the name of Alexs guardian in the novel Ark Angel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Starbright

questions.question: In the play Cymbeline, this dishonest Roman soldier tricked Posthumos into believing that he had seduced his wife, Imogen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iachimo

questions.question: Which of these is true about the second wife of fictional British Royal Navy officer Horatio Hornblower?

options.text: She is the sister of Marie Antoinette, infamous for excesses, and executed early in the French Revolution.
She is the sister of Anglo-Irish statesman Arthur Wellesley, the future victor at Waterloo and Duke of Wellington.
She is the widow of Horatio Nelson, hero of the Nile and Trafalgar.
She is the illegitimate daughter of Benjamin Franklin.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She is the sister of Anglo-Irish statesman Arthur Wellesley, the future victor at Waterloo and Duke of Wellington.

questions.question: In the book Ark Angel, what are the nicknames Alex Rider gives to the four men who break into St. Dominics hospital looking for Paul Drevin?

options.text: Canvas Jacket, Spectacles, Steel Watch, Silver Tooth
Combat Jacket, Spectacles, Steel Watch, Silver Tooth
Canvas Jacket, Spectacles, Metal Watch, Silver Tooth
Combat Jacket, Spectacles, Metal Watch, Steel Tooth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Combat Jacket, Spectacles, Steel Watch, Silver Tooth

questions.question: In the sixth book in the Alex Rider series, what were Force Three going to send with the ransom note to Nikolei Drevin in order to show him that they meant business?

options.text: A lock of their captives hair.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One of their captives fingers.

questions.question: Fictional character Alex Rider says that the leader of Force Three has what parts of the world tattooed on the back of his head?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russia and China

questions.question: In Ark Angel, after Force Three find out that the boy they captured is not Paul Drevin, but Alex Rider, they try to kill him by doing what?

options.text: They lock Alex in a room and leave him there to starve to death.
They lock Alex in a room and leave a time bomb right outside.
They lock Alex in a room and weaken the supports of the building so that it falls down.
They lock Alex in a room and set the building aflame.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They lock Alex in a room and set the building aflame.

questions.question: Jack Starbright, a recurring character in the Alex Rider books, enjoys cooking.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Why does the group of eco-terrorists, featured in the book Ark Angel, call themselves Force Three?

options.text: The Earth is the third nearest planet to the sun.
The group has three main goals.
When the group was created, there were three members in it.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Earth is the third nearest planet to the sun.

questions.question: In what Shakespearean comedy did Don John acknowledge, though I cannot be said to be a flattering honest man, it must not be denied but I am plain-dealing villain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Much Ado About Nothing

questions.question: Living a life of self imposed isolation due to self doubt, fictional Navy officer Hornblower still considered one fellow officer his friend. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lt. Bush

questions.question: What was the name of the first wife of fictional British Royal Navy officer Horatio Hornblower?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maria

questions.question: In the novel Ark Angel, what natural disaster does Alex Rider think would occur if the leader of Force Three was to sneeze?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earthquake

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Harry Potter and Series
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, plums, stephanies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the Stephanie Plum series of novels, what is the name of the plus-sized black woman who sometimes is Stephanies partner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lula

questions.question: How many children does Harry Potter have as revealed in the last book of the harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: Harry Potter marries Hermione in the last book of the series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Harry Potter kisses Cho Chang.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In Janet Evanovichs series of books, Stephanie Plums relationship with her boyfriend is often overshadowed by her crush on this character.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ranger

questions.question: Who does Hermione Granger kiss in the Battle of Hogwarts, in the final book of the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron

questions.question: Where does fictional character Stephanie Plum live?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trenton, New Jersey

questions.question: Fictional character Stephanie Plum is employed by her cousin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What year were fictional characters Harry Potter and Ron Weasley born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1989

questions.question: What is the job of Stephanies boyfriend in the Stephanie Plums series of novels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a police officer

questions.question: Stephanie Plums eccentric Grandma Mazur has a weird obsession with attending viewings at the local funeral parlor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Stephanie Plum has different cars throughout the various novels. However, the one that used to belong to her Uncle Sandor was affectionately called by this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big Blue

questions.question: Fictional officer Horatio Hornblower is dispatched round the Horn to assist the Spanish in the Pacific. Hornblower meets and assists a despotic, psychopathic Spanish commander. What is his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: El Supremo

questions.question: What is the occupation of Janet Evanovichs character Stephanie Plum?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: bounty hunter

questions.question: In the Stephanie Plum series of books, Stephanies mother approves of her job as a bounty-hunter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Harry Potter and Silmarillion
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, lovegood, writings. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What potion do Harry Potter, Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger use to infiltrate the Ministry of Magic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Polyjuice Potion

questions.question: In Tolkiens book The Silmarillion, the kings of Numenor increasingly became rebellious against the Valar and mounted an attack against them. The result was that the island of Numenor sank into the sea. What was the reason for their revolt?

options.text: They wanted the Silmarils for themselves.
They wanted the riches of the Valor.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They lusted after immortality.

questions.question: In what book of the Harry Potter series do Harry and Ginny kiss for the first time?

options.text: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince

questions.question: Which student does Slughorn Horace NOT favour in the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron

questions.question: At the time of the fictional War of the Ring, who were the only surviving leaders of the Noldor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Galadriel and Celeborn

questions.question: What was the name of the Great Elven Prince of the Noldor who created the Silmarils described by J. R. Tolkien?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Feanor

questions.question: Harry Potter once kissed Luna Lovegood.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In Tolkiens writings, Numenor was created as a reward to men by the Valar for their part in the War of the Silmarills. The first king was the son of Earendil, a mortal, and Elwing, an Elf, and brother to Elrond. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elros

questions.question: The epic love story in The Silmarillion held great significance to Tolkien himself. This is evident by the fact that the names of the two lovers were engraved upon the tombstones of J.R.R. and his wife, Edith. What were these names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luthien and Beren

questions.question: What character does Harry Potter first meet at Madam Malkins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Draco

questions.question: Known as the Wildman of the Woods, this tragic hero, described in The Silmarillion, was cursed by Morgoth because his father refused to reveal the location of the secret Elvin kingdom of Gondolin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turin

questions.question: What are the names of the Three Kindreds of Elves in Toliens fictional universe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vanya, Noldor , and Teleri

questions.question: What transgression did fictional character Melkor commit to warrant the revenge of the Valor?

options.text: Seduction of the men of Numenor

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Creation fo the Orcs

questions.question: In The Silmarillion, the Elves call themselves this, meaning The Speakers, signifying their value of communication.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quendi

questions.question: In The Silmarillion, Morgoth was a corrupt Ainu, a servant of Iluvatar, responsible for much evil on Middle Earth. What was his original name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Melkor

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Books and Series
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, rolands, marvel. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the Dark Towere series of books, Eddie Dean mysteriously resembles which one of Rolands dead friends?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cuthbert Allgood

questions.question: In the Twilight saga, both Edward and James are trackers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the name of Rolands first love in The Dark Tower?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Susan Delgado

questions.question: What is the name of the main character in The Dark Tower?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roland Deschain

questions.question: There are a number of evil spheres in the Dark Tower books. What is the name of the most sinister of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Thirteen

questions.question: Among the servants of the Red King in the Dark Tower, there are bird-like creatures that can assume a human form. What are they called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taheen

questions.question: In the Dark Tower series, the woman known as Susannah has a dissociative identity disorder. How many personalities does she have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: In the beginning of the novel Twilight, Isabella moved from Phoenix, Arizona to what city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forks, Washington

questions.question: What is the name of the dog-like billy-bumbler in the Dark Tower series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oy

questions.question: There were a number of notable inter-racial marriages in The Silmarillion. The first one mentioned was between a mortal and a Maia, a servant of the Valar. What were their names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thingol and Melian

questions.question: In 2007 Marvel started a series of comic books based on The Dark Tower. What is the name of the first volume?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gunslinger Born

questions.question: In The Silmarillion, Carcharoth slew Beren after swallowing a Silmaril. What was Carcharoth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: wolf

questions.question: In the universe created by J. R. Tolkien, the Valar were gods and were to be worshipped by men and elves alike.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Roland, the protagonist of the Dark Tower books, is a descendant of this great king.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arthur Eld

questions.question: In the Dark Tower series of books, Jake has a very special ability called The Touch. What is it?

options.text: The power to turn things into gold
The power to kill by thought

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A kind of telekinesis
